cs.helsinki.fi.desu

Class Encryption

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs.helsinki.fi.desu.Encryption

  • public class Encryption
extends java.lang.Object
    The class to encrypt given message.

      Encryption()

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] encrypt64Block(byte[] block, byte[][] subkeys)
      Encrypts a single block of 64 bytes and passes it back to calling method.
      byte[] encryptSingleDES(byte[] data, byte[] key)
      Encrypts data by cycling through DES with supplied key.
      byte[] encryptTripleDES(byte[] data, byte[][] keys)
      Encrypts data by cycling through DES three times with three separate keys.
      byte[] insertPadding(byte[] data)
      Pads the byte array of data to be encrypted.

      • Encryption

        public Encryption()

    • Method Detail

      • encryptTripleDES

        public byte[] encryptTripleDES(byte[] data,
                      byte[][] keys)
        Encrypts data by cycling through DES three times with three separate keys. Each block is first encrypted with key 1, decrypted with key 2 and finally encrypted with key 3.
        Parameters:
        data - data to be encrypted
        keys - three keys to be used in each cycle of encryption
        Returns:
        encrypted data

      • encryptSingleDES

        public byte[] encryptSingleDES(byte[] data,
                      byte[] key)
        Encrypts data by cycling through DES with supplied key.
        Parameters:
        data - data to encrypt
        key - key to use in encryption
        Returns:
        encrypted data

      • encrypt64Block

        public byte[] encrypt64Block(byte[] block,
                    byte[][] subkeys)
        Encrypts a single block of 64 bytes and passes it back to calling method.
        Parameters:
        block - block to be encrypted
        subkeys - set of subkeys to use
        Returns:
        encrypted block

      • insertPadding

        public byte[] insertPadding(byte[] data)
        Pads the byte array of data to be encrypted. If all blocks are full, inserts a block of 0x08, otherwise 0x0n, where n is the number of empty bytes in last block. Implements standard PCKS#5.
        Parameters:
        data - data to be padded
        Returns:
        padded data
